articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kwail County, South Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kwail County, South Hwanghae Province
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave a field guidance to Kwail County, South Hwanghae Province.
					 He went round the Kwail County Revolutionary Museum and the room dedicated to the history of the county.
					
					 Saying that the museum and room are the places associated with the loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who devoted themselves to the people all their lives, he noted that as they have been arranged well as befitting a model of the whole country, it is necessary to meticulously organize education through them so that the party members, working people and school youth and children bear in mind the desire of the great leaders and make positive contributions to building a socialist power as soon as possible.
					
					 He went round the analysis room, information room, e-reading room and other places of the fruit research institute.
					
					 He praised the institute for widely introducing the research successes in the fruit farms with the high aim to put the fruit production on a scientific, modern and intensive basis, cultivating high-yielding fruit trees, steadily improving seeds and setting up the unified command system for scientific fruit farming of each workteam under the condition of climate and weather.
					
					 He enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the county from the observation deck before going round orchards. 
					
					 Touching apples heavily hanging on branches one by one, he noted this is said that apple trees are heavily laden with fruits. It is very great that there are many fruit workteams which produced 70-80 tons of fruits per hectare, and trees are heavily laden with apples as they are laden with over 200 apples on an average per tree, over 300 apples at the maximum, he said with broad laugh. 
					
					 He told earnestly officials to surely convey his thanks to the officials and working people of the county who reaped the richest harvest ever known.
					
					 Kwail County is a model unit which should be put forward in the front ranks of the whole country in the struggle to implement the decisions of the Seventh Congress of the WPK, he said. He thanked it in the name of the chairman of the WPK and made sure that special bonus is given to it.
					
					 Noting that the county should wage a dynamic struggle to make a higher leaping forward on the basis of the achievements made by it this year, he set forth the important tasks facing the county, including the issue of increasing the good fruit species, the issue of keeping the peculiar taste of fruits and updating the fruit processing progress, the issue of meticulously organizing of operation of the sci-tech learning space, the issue of organizing well the operation of pig farms so that the ring-shaped rotation production system of fruit farming and animal husbandry is established, the issue of perfecting drip irrigation system and building natural energy power station suited to the characteristics of topography to smoothly meet the demands of electrify and the issue of flawlessly creating shelter belts.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, Army General So Hong Chan, first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Kim Yong Su and Jo Yong Won, leading officials of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Swedish Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Swedish Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Jonas Michael Wendel at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, he had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Arrives in New York to Attend 72nd UN General Assembly
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Arrives in New York to Attend 72nd UN General Assembly
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK led by Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho arrived in New York Wednesday to attend the 72nd UN General Assembly.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation at Int'l Meeting on Rights of Child
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation at Int'l Meeting on Rights of Child
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A consideration of the 5th and 6th combined report for the DPRK's implementation of the convention on the rights of the child was successfully closed on Wednesday at the 76th session of the Committee on the Rights of the Child which is held in Geneva.
					 Present there was a DPRK delegation led by the DPRK permanent representative to the UN Office and international organizations in Geneva which composed of relevant officials of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, the Central Court, the Education Commission and the Ministry of Public Health and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
					
					 The head of the delegation made a keynote speech on the measures and efforts of the DPRK government for the protection of the children's rights.
					
					 He said:
					
					 Our present Report covers the period 2008-2015.
					
					 During the reporting period, the DPRK adopted a series of legislative and practical measures for the protection and promotion of the rights of the child. They are, for instance, the adoption of the Law on the Protection of the Rights of the Child, promulgation of the Decree on the Introduction of the 12-Year Compulsory Education System and the institution as a national holiday of the founding day of the Children's Union, which was formerly a holiday for children only.
					
					 It is the consistent and unwavering stand of the DPRK to set the protection and promotion of the rights of the child as one of the primary principles of the State activities and provide them with the best of everything.
					
					 Since its birth on September 9, 1948, the DPRK has creditably fulfilled its duty and role as the protector of the rights of the child through providing in its Constitution the issue of protecting the rights of the child and adopting a number of national and social welfare policies.
					
					 Today, children in the DPRK are valued as the treasure of the country and masters of the future, growing up to be able workers, knowledgeable, morally sound and physically fit thanks to the policy of prioritizing children and love of young generation of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The persistent and vicious embargo and sanctions against the DPRK are not only hampering the endeavors for the protection and promotion of the rights of the child but also seriously threatening their right to survival.
					
					 Such is the persistency and inhumanity of the sanctions imposed by the hostile forces against the DPRK that even the right of the child to good educational conditions and environment are violated.
					
					 Such inhumane and hideous sanctions against the DPRK that constitute violations of the ideal of humanitarianism and the spirit of the Convention must be lifted without any conditions and without delay.
					
					 The DPRK, as a State party to the Convention, will do its best in the future too to implement its obligations under the Convention in close cooperation with the Committee.
					
					 Members of the Committee on the Rights of the Child appraised the measures and achievements of the DPRK for protecting and promoting the rights of the child and asked a series of questions and the DPRK delegation gave full answers.
					
					 The participation of the DPRK delegation to the session served as an important occasion showing that the DPRK is fully displaying its mission in the field of human rights including the protection and promotion of the rights of the child and attaching importance to the international dialogue and cooperation for the protection and promotion of genuine human rights.

articles.title: Tokyo District Court's Unjust Decision on Korean Students in Japan Slashed
articles.content:
Tokyo District Court's Unjust Decision on Korean Students in Japan Slashed 
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Aiding Overseas Compatriots of Korea in a statement Thursday denounced the Japanese reactionaries for getting zealous in their discrimination against Koreans in Japan and persecution against them by taking the advantage of the U.S. imperialists' racket for sanctions against the DPRK.
					 They let the Tokyo District Court unilaterally decline without any legal grounds the just call made by the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan for the application of tuition-free program for senior high schools to the senior students of Korean middle and high school in Tokyo on September 13.
					
					 The judge of the court, referring to the struggle of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan, declined the demand of the plaintiff side and asserted that the trial cost shall be borne by the plaintiff side without giving any reasoning, only to shock the public.
					
					 Being displeased with the just demand of the Koreans in Japan from the beginning, the Tokyo District Court delayed the case. Upset by the vexing demand from the Japanese reactionary authorities that they should not lose initiative at the Tokyo trial, the court declined the agenda carrying the important demand related to the future of Koreans in Japan in just ten seconds.
					
					 The statement said that this shameless act of the Tokyo District Court is a revelation of the deep-rooted bad intention of the Japanese reactionaries to undermine the national education for Koreans in Japan and also clearly proves the despicable nature of the Japanese authorities keen on frantic moves against the DPRK and Chongryon while faulting the DPRK's just step for bolstering the nuclear deterrence for self-defence. 
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The despicable and trite hostile act of the Japanese reactionaries who are using the issue of the national education for Koreans in Japan as a means for political and diplomatic pressure on Chongryon is a criminal act that can never be tolerated.
					
					 The application of the tuition-free program for students of the Korean senior high schools has no ground to be declined or rejected in the light of the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation in the past and from the aspect of international law and viewpoint of Japanese laws.
					
					 The recent unjust decision made by the court under the behind-the-scene manipulation of the Japanese authorities is a wanton violation of law and vicious human rights abuses against humanity in breach of International Convention on Human Rights on ensuring foreigners equal right to education.
					
					 The vicious discrimination and suppression perpetrated by the Japanese reactionaries against Koreans in Japan and their children for the mere reason that they are Koreans can never evade curse and censure by the international community, to say nothing by all Koreans.
					
					 The Japanese justicial authorities should behave with discretion, deeply repenting of what a big disastrous consequence the recent decision made to chime in those in power will have on the development of the DPRK-Japan relations.

articles.title: 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships Close
articles.content:
20th Taekwon-Do World Championships Close
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships were closed on Thursday with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall in Pyongyang.
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Premier Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK who is chairman of the National Sports Guidance Committee, Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who is chairman of the organizing committee of the championships, officials concerned, working people and youths and students in Pyongyang.
					
					 It was also attended by Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, and executive members of the ITF, chairmen of the standing committee, chairmen of continental federations, representatives from national associations, diplomatic envoys of different countries and staff members of international bodies here and other foreign guests and overseas Koreans.
					
					 Successful countries, teams and players were awarded prizes at the ceremony.
					
					 The DPRK players took the first place in the countries' standings, bagging 3 trophy cups, 22 gold medals, 9 silvers and 4 bronzes.
					
					 Kim Kyong Ho said in a closing address that the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee would as ever boost friendship and cooperation with all Taekwon-Do practicians aspiring after peace and actively contribute to developing the ITF into a prestigious and powerful organization of martial arts.
					
					 An art performance was given at the end of the ceremony.
					
					 The following are the standings of the championships:
						
					
					 Countries' standing
					
					1. DPRK
					
					2. Russia
						
					
					3. Czech Republic 
					
					Team's winner
					
					 Men: DPRK
					
					 Women: DPRK
					
					Technical prize
					
					 Man: Andrii Klymenko (Ukraine)
					
					 Woman: Ri Un Jong (DPRK)
					
					Team's sparring match
					
					 Men
					
					1. Russia
					
					2. DPRK
					
					3. Iran, Ukraine
					
					   Women
					
					1. DPRK
					
					2. Russia
					
					3. Czech Republic, Bulgaria

articles.title: Fourth-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
articles.content:
Fourth-Day Events of Taekwon-Do World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The fourth-day events of the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships took place at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Thursday.
					 As the total standings of the countries would be decided by the result of the games of the day, the players successfully showcased the advantages and power of the orthodox Taekwon-Do and its development by fully displaying their physical and technical abilities which they have cultivated in their day-to-day trainings.
					
					 The following are the results of the third-day events of the championships held on Wednesday:
					
					 
					
					 Men's individual 50kg sparring match
					
					1. Ri Kwon Il (DPRK)
					
					2. Shen Zhenzhe (China)
					
					3. Avet Kushchian (Russia), Ibragim Ibragimov (Russia)
						
					
					 Men's individual 57kg sparring match
					
					1. Evgenii Otsimik (Russia)
					
					2. Ri Tu Song (DPRK)
					
					3. Hor Vichet (Cambodia), Achiko Aron (Uganda)
						
					
					 Men's individual 64kg sparring match
					
					1. Wang Myong Guk (DPRK)
					
					2. Azat Shuitbayev (Kazakhstan)
					
					3. Abdul Hutsaev (Russia), Mykola Yakovenko (Ukraine)
						
					
					 Women's individual 45kg sparring match
					
					1. Ri Un Jong (DPRK)
					
					2. Miller Kirsty (England)
					
					3. Mariia Klochkova (Russia), Kremzhanova (Kazakhstan)
					
					
					
					 Women's individual 51kg sparring match

					2. Luliia Sukhareva (Russia)
					
					3. Anna Tishchenko (Russia), Jenine Hutchison (England)
						
					
					Men's self-defense match
					
					1. DPRK
					
					2. Mongolia
					
					3. India
						
					
					Women's self-defense match

					2. Russia
					
					3. Czech Republic
						
					
					Men's individual demonstration
					
					1. Yordan Staev (Bulgaria)
					
					2. Andrii Klymenko (Ukraine)
					
					3. BattulgaJargal (Mongolia)
						
					
					Women's individual demonstration
					
					1. Kim Un Hwa (DPRK)
					
					2. Karen Frondigoun (Scotland)
					
					3. Ros Sreynich (Cambodia)
						
					
					Men's team demonstration
					
					1. Mongolia
					
					2. Bulgaria
					
					3. DPRK
						
					
					Women's team demonstration
					
					1. Czech Republic
					
					2. DPRK
					
					3. England
						
					
					Men's individual technique
					
					1. Khvan Ilya (Kazakhstan)
					
					2. Nikola Nikolov (Bulgaria)
					
					3. Aleksandr Poliakov (Russia)
						
					
					Women's individual technique

					2. Kokasova Veronika (Czech Republic)
					
					3. Elizaveta Pronchatova (Russia)

					2. Kazakhstan
					
					3. Cambodia
						
					
					Women's team technique
					
					1. Czech Republic
					
					2. Russia
					
					3. DPRK.

articles.title: Participants of Taekwon-Do World Championships Feted
articles.content:
Participants of Taekwon-Do World Championships Feted
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet gave a reception at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday for the participants of the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships.
					 Present there on invitation were Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, ITF Honorary President Chang Ung, executive members of the ITF, chairmen of the standing committee, chairmen of the continental federations, representatives from national associations and teams and delegations of different countries and regions.
					
					 Attending it were Vice-Premier Jon Kwang Ho, Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who is chairman of the organizing committee of the championships, and officials concerned.
					
					 Jon Kwang Ho said in his speech that the DPRK government would pay deep attention to Taekwon-Do, upholding the instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, and more positively cooperate in the worldwide spread and development of Taekwon-Do.
					
					 He expressed belief that the ITF would develop the Taekwon-Do technique and strengthen harmony and unity of the Taekwon-Do practicians as required by its mission as a martial arts organization under the unfurled banner of justice and peace.
					
					 Leong Wai Meng, vice-president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation, noted in his speech that the orthodox Taekwon-Do practicians will always remember the love and solicitude shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for Choe Hong Hui and the ITF.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do Players Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do Players Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Taekwon-Do players taking part in the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships Thursday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 The visitors paid tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the palace.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders at immortality halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: 9th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
9th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on Thursday.
					 On display at the exhbition are more than 1 900 musical instruments of over 90 kinds, parts of instruments, articles of consumption and jigs and tools for manufacturing instruments, manufactured by musical instruments production units, organs for art education, factories and enterprises and individual musical instruments producers.
					
					 The exhibition will involve experience-sharing, information for science and technology, concert and other events.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were officials, researchers, working people of relevant fields and units that presented instruments, teachers and students of art educational field, overseas Koreans and foreigners who presented musical instruments.
					
					 Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, made an opening address. 
					
					 The exhibition will last till Sept. 25.

articles.title: Hypothetical and Idea Presentation Held
articles.content:
Hypothetical and Idea Presentation Held
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The 10th national hypothetical and idea presentation took place in Hamhung (eastern coastal areas) and Sariwon (western coastal areas) from September 19 to 21 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists, researchers, teachers, technicians and field-officials of science and education institutions and industrial establishments, including the State Academy of Sciences, Institute of Agricultural Science, Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Hamhung University of Chemical Industry, the Chollima Steel Complex, the Musan Mining Complex and the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex.
					
					 Presented were more than 350 papers of hypothesis and ideas conducive to putting the national economy including electricity, metal, chemistry, coal and railway transport on a Juche-oriented, modern and scientific basis, and developing core basic technologies such as information engineering, Nano technology and bionics.
					
					 There was a lecture on the development of C One chemical industry.

articles.title: Sci-tech Presentation in Field of Coal Industry Held
articles.content:
Sci-tech Presentation in Field of Coal Industry Held
 Phyongsong, September 21 (KCNA) -- A national sci-tech presentation in the field of coal industry took place at the Namdok Youth Coal Mine of the Pukchang Area Youth Coal Mining Complex on Wednesday and Thursday.
					 Present there were officials, teachers and researchers of the Institute of Coal, the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, Kaechon Area Coal Mining Complex, Pukchang Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, affiliated units of the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Phyongsong University of Coal Industry and other units.
					
					 The participants heard more than 170 valuable papers.
					
					 They introduced and exchanged scientific and technological achievements and experience gained in the coal industry.
					
					 Lectures were also given on the research into increasing anthracite mining rate and developing the watch information system by the three-dimension underground information system, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Woman Centenarian Birthday Spread
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Woman Centenarian Birthday Spread
 Unryul, September 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Kim Tan Ok, a female centenarian residing in Kumsanpho Workers' District, Unryul County, South Hwanghae Province.
					 Born into a poor tenant's family in Pyokdong County, North Phyongan Province, Kim Tan Ok experienced sorrow as a member of the stateless nation, being subject to all sorts of humiliation and contempt.
					
					 She could lead a genuine life only when President Kim Il Sung liberated the country, and in order to live up to the benevolence of the Workers' Party of Korea, she brought up her children to be good and sent them to the outposts of national defense and difficult and labor consuming fields.
					
					 Saying that thanks to the most advantageous socialist system of our country she can enjoy longevity, she always asks her descendants to do more good things for the grateful country.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un on September 19 received a letter from the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan to celebrate the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The letter said that it was the greatest honor and happiness that they celebrated the significant September holiday together with the people in the motherland under the care of Kim Jong Un at the exciting time when Juche Korea was demonstrating its might and invincibility all over the world.
					
					 It noted that Kim Jong Un demonstrated once again before the world the mightiness and inevitability of Juche Korea ahead of the founding anniversary of the DPRK, dealing heavy blows at the enemies trying to deprive the Korean people of their sovereignty and right to existence and flying the flag of the DPRK in the clear and blue sky in September.
					
					 We enshrined the truth that the final victory of the Korean revolution is sure to win as it is led by the respected Marshal, witnessing the tremendous might of the DPRK through the great success of ICBM-ready H-bomb test which jolted the world and army-people rallies that more significantly celebrated the September holiday, the letter pointed out.
					
					 Indeed, the DPRK will prosper for all ages as Kim Jong Un's strongest power envied by the whole world thanks to him, the letter said, adding:
					
					 We will firmly believe and follow only the respected Marshal in any storm and stress and record the history of the movement of Koreans in Japan associated with the noble patriotism and compatriotism of the peerlessly great men as the ever-lasting annals of patriotism and loyalty.

articles.title: Hyesan-Samjiyon Broad-gauge Railway Construction Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Hyesan-Samjiyon Broad-gauge Railway Construction Progresses Apace
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The construction of the Hyesan-Samjiyon broad-gauge railway is progressing apace at the final stage as part of the work to spruce up Samjiyon County in Ryanggang Province, the DPRK.
					 After finishing the project of roadbeds of tens of kilometers under the unified command of the 216 Division, members of its shock brigade are simultaneously propelling the projects for laying rails, electrifying railway and building railway stations and dwelling houses of railway workers.
					
					 Industrial establishments of relevant field are giving priority to supplying iron and steel, cement, rails, sleepers and other building materials, equipment and accessories.
					
					 Pyongyang City and South Hamgyong, South Hwanghae and other provinces are positively aiding the projects.

articles.title: New Poems Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Poems Produced in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Poets of the Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea have produced dozens of poems praising the era of the great power.
					 Among them are poems singing of the Korean people's immense pride and honor of living in the nuclear power of Juche, a world military power.
					
					 Poems "Greatest General" and "No One Can Match Korea" represent the steadfast faith of the army and people of the DPRK that they are sure to emerge victorious under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 "Answer of Korea", "America on doom" and other poems stress that the great thunder of H-bomb which jolted the earth is a stern declaration of Juche Korea to the gangsters trying to stamp out the sovereignty of the country and its rights to existence and development.
					
					 Such poems as "Lightning in September" and "Thunder of H-bomb" show the Korean army and people's will to annihilate the U.S. imperialists and the group of traitors and accomplish the historic cause of national reunification and win the final victory in the standoff with the U.S.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Brilliant Life
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Brilliant Life
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Just after Korea's liberation from the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists, Saegil Sinmun (newspaper at that time) carried an article. 
					 The article said that through fierce tiger-like activities in the vast Manchurian plain with his great intention for national liberation General Kim Il Sung struck terror into the hearts of the Japanese warlords and demonstrated his valor. He is indeed a revolutionary produced by Korea. He is acting in Pyongyang in good health, it added.
					
					 One day of November Juche 34 (1945), reporters of Saegil Sinmun called on anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk, wanting to hear her stories as she defeated one million Japanese imperialists in the vast Manchurian plain.
					
					 She declined their request, saying they should write about Kim Il Sung who led the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory. And she told them about his greatness, outstanding strategies and tactics for long hours.
					
					 She requested them to explain well his lines and policies so that the masses turn out as one in the building of a new country.
					
					 The desire of the reporters to give wide publicity to her feats was not realized.
					
					 Newspaper carrying this press interview was distributed to North Hamgyong Province, Pyongyang and all other parts of the country to evoke a great response among the people.
					
					 Such looks of Kim Jong Suk, who upheld Kim Il Sung's cause of nation-building with loyalty after the liberation of Korea, too, as the safeguard, is instilling deep into the hearts of the Korean people the truth that the life of revolutionary shines only under the care of the leader.

articles.title: Minju Joson on S. Korean Authorities' Sycophantic Diplomacy
articles.content:
Minju Joson on S. Korean Authorities' Sycophantic Diplomacy
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- An "alienation theory of south Korea" has rapidly mounted among the south Korean puppet forces after the DPRK's perfect success in the H-bomb test.
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The puppet authorities can hardly find fault with anyone as regards the "alienation theory of south Korea" which shakes the political landscape of south Korea.
					
					 The very one responsible for the "theory" is none other than the puppet authorities who have pursued sycophancy towards the U.S. and cooperation with foreign forces without any principle and malignantly slandered the measures for bolstering up the nuclear force in the north.
					
					 They have worked hard to defame the DPRK's measures for self-defense and stifle the fellow countrymen without gauging the meaning and world-historic weight of the great event in the national history brought about by the fellow countrymen in the north. Moreover, they toured different countries for "cooperation in putting pressure upon the north," not content with echoing the American master's stereotyped trumpeting about "nuclear threat from the north".
					
					 After taking office, the authorities bluffed, talking about "restoration of normal diplomacy through dispatch of a special envoy", but they soon revealed their pro-U.S. nature, given a shot in the arm by their American master. Who can trust those stooges bereft of any principle and independent views? After all, the south Korean authorities find themselves in such awkward position rejected by the international community as they are stuck in the abyss of pro-U.S. diplomacy for being a marionette regime.
					
					 What is clear is that the present south Korean authorities will follow in the footsteps of the Park Geun Hye regime which met a miserable end, forsaken by the people, if they persist in the pro-U.S. sycophantic diplomacy and the policy for confrontation with the fellow countrymen.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Regime to Awake from Daydream
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Regime to Awake from Daydream
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- In the wake of the DPRK's successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test, the international community contends that the DPRK should be recognized as a nuclear weapons state, while south Koreans are vocal in denouncing the authorities' failure of "north policy".
					 However, the south Korean authorities, failing to see such trend of the world, distort the reality and spread such sophism as "simultaneously pushing ahead with settlement of the nuclear issue of the north and improvement of inter-Korean relations", persistently taking issue with the DPRK's measures for bolstering its nuclear force.
					
					 In this regard, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in an article:
					
					 Over the DPRK's H-bomb test, the south Korean chief executive hastily had phone talks with the U.S. and Japanese masters and busied himself with additional deployment of THAAD launching pads. Meanwhile, he cried for consistent maintaining the "simultaneous pushing of the settlement of the nuclear issue of the north and improvement of north-south relations". It is a foolish behavior to build up the opinion on the "nuclear issue of the north" while denying the position of the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state, and save the south Korean regime's face and escalate the campaign of sanctions on the DPRK in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 The "settlement of the north's nuclear issue" much touted by the south Korean puppet regime is, in essence, to disarm the DPRK in conspiracy with the U.S. master and realize the ambition for invasion of the north, and this can never go together with improvement of the inter-Korean relations. They seek to hurt the fellow countrymen in collusion with outsiders under the signboard of "settlement of the nuclear issue" while talking about "improvement of the inter-Korean relations". This is self-contradictory and it is very clear that there is nothing to expect.
					
					 The "simultaneous pushing of the settlement of the nuclear issue of the north and the improvement of inter-Korean relations" is a nonsensical talk of those obsessed with a foolish daydream.

articles.title: Japan's Constitutional Revision Aims at Reinvasion: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Constitutional Revision Aims at Reinvasion: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Two conflicting cases happened over the issue of revising the constitution in Japan.
					 An "executive committee of all citizens' activities against Abe's revision of article 9 of the constitution" was formed in Tokyo Metropolis on Sept. 4.
					
					 On contrary to this, Ishiba, ex-chief secretary of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan, on Sep. 5 said in a lecture that the existence of the "Self-Defense Forces" should be specified in the constitution.
					
					 This goes to prove that the conflict between political circles and the public mindset in Japan is festering over the revision of the constitution, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a commentary. It goes on:
					
					 Now the Japanese political circle has turned extremely reactionary and ultra-rightist, going against the public mindset to reduce the "Pacifist Constitution" to a war constitution.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' goal is to take revenge for their past failure by realizing their old dream "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere", and herein lies the real reason for scrambling to stipulate the existence of the "SDF" in article 9 of the constitution.
					
					 When the articles prohibiting Japan's access to war forces and right of belligerency are removed, what is happening? It is just the permission of reinvasion.
					
					 It is the essence of the racket for the constitutional revision to turn the "SDF" into the Japanese army which used to invade other countries, seized by a daydream "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere", and hurl the forces into reinvasion.
					
					 The moves for the retrogressive revision of the constitution are not just for simple modification of phrases, and this issue is directly linked to the future of Japan and peace in the Asia-Pacific region. That's why other Asian countries and nations are very vigilant against such moves of Japan. The Japanese people, too, are strongly opposed to the revision.
					
					 Reinvasion precisely means a doom for Japan, an island country island nation.

articles.title: U.S. Can't Evade Blame for Tension on Korean Peninsula: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Can't Evade Blame for Tension on Korean Peninsula: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Recently, the assertion is raised in the international arena that the cause of escalating tension on the Korean peninsula should be rooted out and a right solution to the issue sought.
					 Experts and public opinions in different countries assert in chorus that the development of nuclear weapon in the DPRK, exposed to the constant threat of the U.S., can be interpreted as a wise option.
					
					 Minju Joson on Thursday says in a commentary that the U.S. is entirely to blame for the periodic tension on the Korean peninsula, which has now reaching the alarming phase, just as the fair world opinion claims.
					
					 If the U.S. hadn't occupied the half of Korea and hadn't threatened the DPRK with nukes for several decades, the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula shouldn't have spawned and the situation shouldn't have reached such an alarming phase as today, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK, which has lasted for decades, made the latter to make a crucial decision to protect the safety of the country and the nation and its sovereignty, and it is the historical cause of pushing the DPRK to rapidly bolster up its nuclear force.
					
					 If the UN, whose main mission is to preserve world peace and security, is to work in conformity with its duty, it should naturally fault the U.S. that spawned the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula and is driving the situation into an extreme phase.
					
					 In order to defuse the tension on the Korean peninsula and maintain peace and stability in the region, the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and its moves for igniting a nuclear war should be put to an end.
					
					 Steadfast are the stand and will of the Party and government of the DPRK to reliably guarantee the country's sovereignty and security by its own efforts.
					
					 We will continue its dynamic march along the road of simultaneously developing the two fronts no matter what others may say and will never put on the negotiating table the precious nuclear strategic assets prepared by tightening our belts.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists and Puppet Marine Corps Wage Joint Drill
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists and Puppet Marine Corps Wage Joint Drill
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the south Korean puppet marines waged a joint drill on September 19 aimed to infiltrate into the rear of the DPRK in the event of emergency, the south Korean radio KBS said.
					 In the drill the puppet warmongers of south Korea waged the drill of destroying objects under the air support of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces after infiltrating into the spot chosen as the rear of the DPRK using their transports.
					
					 Involved in it were huge troops of the U.S. imperialists and puppet marines, transports, helicopters, tanks, landing armored vehicles and others.

articles.title: S. Koreans Urge U.S. to Abandon Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
S. Koreans Urge U.S. to Abandon Hostile Policy toward DPRK
Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Council for National Independence and the Peaceful Reunification, the Headquarters for the Peace Treaty and the People's Democratic Party of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on September 18, urging the U.S. to abandon the hostile policy toward the DPRK, according to the south Korean online paper Minjok Ilbo.
					 A statement was read out in the rally.
					
					 The statement said the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drill proved that the U.S. was trying to swallow up the whole Korean peninsula through nuclear disaster.
					
					 It stressed that the organizations will stage indomitable struggle with the people to make the U.S. abandon its hostile policy.
					
					 After the rally, the organizations presented a letter of protest to the U.S. embassy.
					
					 Then the participants marched to the "government" building.

articles.title: Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The "Joint Action for Release of Prisoners of Conscience, Pardon and Reinstatement against Suppression under Pretence of Public Security" grouping civic and social organizations held a press conference outside the Seoul Detention House on Sep. 18, urging the release of all the prisoners of conscience, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					 Speakers there said prisoners of conscience are now detained for the mere reasons that they wished national reunification, took part in the trade union activities and they were members of the Unified Progressive Party.
					
					  They declared that they would launch struggle for the release of all the prisoners of conscience outside prisons and detention houses in all parts of south Korea for five days with the press conference as its start.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits to DPRK Missions
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Delegations of political parties and personages in various countries made congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions from September 7 to 10 on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included a delegation of the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia, a delegation of political parties of Nigeria, the deputy head of the International Department of the C.C., Communist Party of Cuba, the commander of the Air and Anti-Aircraft Defense Forces of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, the president of the Prensa Latina News Agency, the general secretary of the C.C., United Socialist Nationalist Party of Nepal, the chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, the chairman of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal, the secretary general of the Bangladesh Jatiya Party, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and the secretary of the Chamberlain of the Egyptian Presidency.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets at the pictures of President Kim Il Sung standing together with leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Meanwhile, the general chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle sent a large floral board and basket to the DPRK mission. Also floral baskets were sent to DPRK missions by the foreign minister of Algeria, the defense minister of Laos who is Politburo member of the C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) and members of the C.C., LPRP, the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, the Ministry of Public Security and the C.C., National Construction Front of Laos and the government of Geneva Canton of Switzerland floral baskets to the DPRK missions.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversary Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversary Marked in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Laos, Pakistan, Ecuador, Austria and Germany from September 6 to 8 in celebration of the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Attending the meetings were personages of political and social circles and masses.
					
					 A vice-chairman of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association said that for 69 years the DPRK has made world-startling miracles and innovations in all spheres and registered big successes in bolstering up the military capabilities and building socialism thanks to the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association noted that the President set forth the original idea and theory of nation-building and founded the DPRK on Sept. 9, 1948.
					
					 The secretary general of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification said that Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea has firmly defended its sovereignty and dignity while smashing the U.S. imperialists' frantic sanctions and pressure under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un, iron-willed brilliant commander with great pluck.
					
					 The secretary general of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK and other personages stressed that Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and the progressives of the world as he liberated Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and built a genuine people's country, an independent and sovereign state.
					
					 The chief of the Dresden Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany said that the DPRK would emerge victorious in the future, too, as it is led by Kim Jong Un and regards the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as its guiding idea.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Austria.

articles.title: U.S. Was Invader in Guise of "Liberator": Venezuelan Body
articles.content:
U.S. Was Invader in Guise of "Liberator": Venezuelan Body
 Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at a university of Venezuela on Sep. 8 posted on its website Juche Idea an article titled "Why the U.S. troops are stationed in south Korea" and such subtitled articles as "Invader in the guise of 'liberator'" and "Main obstacle to Korea's reunification."
					 The articles cited detailed data to disclose that the U.S. is chiefly responsible for Korea's division as it sent its troops in the guise of "liberator" to south Korea on Sep. 8 1945.
					
					 With an ambition to rule Korea as a whole, the U.S. imperialists ignited a war of aggression against the DPRK on June 25, 1950 and coiled up tension on the Korean peninsula after the war by making a series of moves to provoke another war--the incident of U.S. armed spy ship Pueblo, the large-sized spy plane "EC-121" incident and "Panmunjom" incident, etc, they noted.
					
					 It is the clear understanding of the world community that the U.S., which has scrambled to perpetuate the Korean nation's division and inflamed the inter-Korean conflict, is the stumbling block to Korea's reunification as well as to peace and security in the Korean peninsula and Northeast Asia, they stressed.
					
					 The articles contended that if the U.S. troops withdraw from south Korea, the root cause of war will vanish and the situation be improved on the peninsula and a favorable phase be provided for peace and security in Northeast Asia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita el distrito de Kwail de provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita el distrito de Kwail de provincia de Hwanghae del Sur
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, realizo una visita de orientacion sobre el distrito de Kwail de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					El recorrio primero el museo de la historia revolucionaria y la sala de presentacion del historial del distrito.
					
					El museo y la sala son los lugares que sintetizan el amor por el pueblo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il que dedicaron todo lo suyo a las masas populares durante su vida, dijo.
					
					Instruyo organizar bien la educacion en ambos lugares acondicionados como modelos de todo el pais, de modo que los militantes del partido, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares contribuyan mucho a construir cuanto antes una potencia socialista prospera teniendo bien presente el deseo de los lideres antecesores.
					
					Seguidamente, visito el instituto de fruticultura y recorrio las salas de analisis, informacion y lectura electronica, etc.
					
					Elogio al instituto por haber introducido ampliamente en las granjas fruticolas los exitos de investigacion con la meta de hacer cientifica, moderna e intensiva la produccion de frutas, cultivado los arboles frutales de buena variedad mejorando constantemente las semillas y establecido el sistema de mando unificado para que cada equipo de trabajo pueda realizar de manera cientifica el cultivo de frutas conforme a las condiciones meteorologicas y climaticas.
					
					Contemplo desde el mirador el panorama del distrito y paso revista a las huertas.
					
					Tocando una por otra las manzanas dadas en abundancia, el Mariscal esbozo una sonrisa por el hecho que numerosos equipos de trabajo produjeron de 70 a 80 toneladas por hectarea y hay muchos manzanos en que se dieron como promedio mas de 200 manzanas por arbol y mas de 300 como maximo.
					
					Pidio decirles a los funcionarios y trabajadores del distrito de Kwail que el les agradece por la produccion muy abundante de frutas que ha visto hoy.
					
					El distrito de Kwail es la unidad modelo digna de ser colocada en la primera fila de todo el pais en la lucha por la materializacion de la resolucion del VII Congreso del PTC, evaluo y concedio la gratificacion especial expresando agradecimiento en nombre del Presidente del PTC.
					
					Diciendo que el distrito debe intensificar la lucha por dar mas saltos a base de los exitos logrados este ano, presento las tareas importantes que le corresponden tales como aumentar buenas variedades de frutas, mantener el sabor peculiar de ellas y modernizar el proceso de su procesamiento, mejorar la operacion de la sala de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas, gestionar bien las granjas porcinas para poder establecer el sistema de produccion circular entre la fruticultura y la ganaderia, perfeccionar el sistema de riego a chorros, construir la central de energias naturales conveniente a las condiciones propias de la region para cubrir las demandas de electricidad y formar perfectamente el bosque rompevientos.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del Comite Central del PTC, el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres, So Hong Chan, primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, y los cuadros del CC del PTC, Kim Yong Su y Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador de Suecia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador de Suecia
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio hoy en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario del Reino de Suecia, Jonas Michael Wendel.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Delegacion coreana participa en la deliberacion del reporte de la RPDC
articles.content:
Delegacion coreana participa en la deliberacion del reporte de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Concluyo con exito el dia 20 en la 76a sesion del Comite sobre los Derechos del Nino de la ONU, que transcurre en Ginebra, la deliberacion sobre el reporte combinado (del quinto y el sexto) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea sobre la implementacion del Convenio de los Derechos del Nino.
					En la ocasion participo la delegacion coreana encabezada por el representante permanente de la RPDC ante el Secretariado de la ONU en Ginebra y otras organizaciones internacionales e integrada por los funcionarios del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, el Tribunal Central, el Comite de Educacion, el Ministerio de Salud Publica y el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores.
					
					El jefe de la delegacion coreana pronuncio el discurso de base que presenta las medidas y esfuerzos del gobierno de la RPDC para proteger y fomentar los derechos de la infancia.
					
					El reporte, que hemos presentado esta vez a la ONU, cubre el periodo 2008-2015, comenzo el y continuo:
					
					En ese tiempo, la RPDC tomo muchas medidas legales y practicas para proteger y fomentar en el interior del pais los derechos de la infancia tales como la adopcion de la ley de garantia de derechos de ninos, la publicacion de la ley de ensenanza obligatoria general de doce anos, la institucion del dia de fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea como fiesta nacional, etc.
					
					Desde el 9 de septiembre de 1948, dia de su fundacion, la RPDC mantiene la posicion invariable de dar primero y todo lo mejor a la poblacion infantil considerando el problema de proteccion de sus derechos como el maximo principio de las actividades estatales.
					
					La RPDC vino cumpliendo responsablemente su mision y papel de protector de los derechos de ninos estipulando este tema en la Constitucion y aplicando sin parar las politicas estatales y sociales para ese efecto.
					
					Hoy dia, todos los ninos de la RPDC crecen robustamente como tesoros nacionales, protagonistas del futuro y talentosos dotados de ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud gracias a la politica de amor del Maximo Dirigente 
					
					Kim Jong Un por las generaciones venideras.
					
					La implementacion del Convenio mencionado y el fomento de derechos de la infancia tropiezan ahora con graves desafios.
					
					La obstinada politica hostil y la sancion antietica de EE.UU. contra la RPDC constituyen enormes obstaculos en facilitar las condiciones de educacion, salud y vida de ninos, por lo cual todas las formas de sancion inhumana deben ser canceladas incondicionalmente ahora mismo. 
					
					Como signataria del Convenio, la RPDC se esforzara mucho en el futuro tambien por implementar plenamente las obligaciones del Convenio en estrecha cooperacion con el Comite sobre los Derechos del Nino.
					
					En la reunion, los miembros del Comite evaluaron las medidas tomadas en los ultimos anos por la RPDC para proteger y fomentar los derechos de la infancia y los exitos alcanzados en ese curso y planteo algunas preguntas a que la delegacion coreana dio perfectas respuestas.
					
					La participacion de la delegacion coreana en la 76a sesion del Comite sobre los Derechos del Nino de la ONU devino una oportunidad importante para demostrar que la RPDC cumple todas sus obligaciones en la esfera de DDHH, inclusive la proteccion y fomento de DDHH de la infancia, y concede mucha importancia al dialogo y cooperacion internacionales para el fomento de los derechos humanos verdaderos.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de Hassan Rouhani
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de Hassan Rouhani
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le dirigiera el dia 18 el Presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 9 de septiembre, dia de fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, le extiendo mis sinceras felicitaciones a Su Excelencia y al pueblo de vuestro pais.
					
					Deseo que las relaciones bilaterales se desarrollen favorablemente en todos los dominios por la cooperacion y los esfuerzos mutuos de los pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					Formulo votos por la salud de Su Excelencia y exitos en sus trabajos y la prosperidad del pueblo de la RPDC.

articles.title: Clausurado el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
articles.content:
Clausurado el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurado el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do inaugurado en esta capital.
					  La ceremonia clausural tuvo lugar el dia 21 en el Palacio de Taekwondo.
					
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidum del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC y presidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwondo de Corea y del comite organizativo del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do, los funcionarios interesados, los trabajadores y los jovenes y estudiantes de esta ciudad.
					
					  Y tomaron parte Ri Yong Son, presidente de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwon-do (ITF en ingles) y del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales (CIJAM), los miembros ejecutivos de ITF, los presidentes de los comites permanentes y de las federaciones continentales, los representantes de las asociaciones nacionales, los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas y de organizaciones internacionales en Corea y otros huespedes extranjeros y los coreanos residentes en ultramar.
					
					  En la ceremonia de clausura hubo premiacion a los paises, equipos y jugadores sobresalientes.
					
					  En la cita deportiva, los taekwondocas coreanos obtuvieron 3 copas, 22 de medalla de oro, 9 de la de plata y 4 de la de cobre, asi que ocuparon el primer lugar en ranking de paises.
					
					  En su discurso de la ocasion, el presidente Kim Kyong Ho subrayo que en el futuro tambien, el Comite de Taekwondo de Corea estrechara la amistad y cooperaciones con todos los taekwondocas del mundo aspirantes a la paz y contribuira al desarrollo de ITF como una prestigiosa organizacion de artes marciales.
					
					  Terminada ceremonia, hobo la funcion.
					
					  En el orden general de los paises del presente campeonato la RPDC ocupo el primer lugar, Rusia, el segundo lugar y Checo, el tercer lugar.
					
					  Los grupos de ambos sexos de la RPDC salieron victoriosos.
					
					El taekwondoca de Ucrania, Andrii Klymenko, y la de Corea, Ri Un Jong, recibieron el premio de tecnica respectivamente.
					
					En el parrins colectivo masculino, Rusia ocupo el primer lugar, Corea, el segundo e Iran y Ucrania, el tercer, mientras que en el femenino, Corea, el primer lugar, Rusia, el segundo y Checo y Bulgaria, el tercer.

articles.title: Noticias de la cuarta jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
articles.content:
Noticias de la cuarta jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 21 en el Palacio de Taekwon-do los juegos de cuarta jornada del XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do.
					Los jugadores mostraron excelentemente la superioridad, poderio y aspecto de desarrollo de Taekwon-do ortodoxo usando al maximo su capacidad fisica y tecnica porque el ranking general de los paises se decidia segun los resultados de la cuarta jornada.
					
					Los resultados de la tercera jornada (el dia 20) van como sigue:
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 50kg
					
					1o lugar: Ri Gwon Il (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Shen Zhenzhe (China)
					
					3o lugar: Avet Kushchian (Rusia), Ibragim Ibragimov (Rusia)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 57kg
					
					1o lugar: Evgenii Otsimik (Rusia)
					
					2o lugar: Ri Tu Song (RPDC)
					
					3o lugar: Hor Vichet (Camboya), Achiko Aron (Uganda)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (m) de la categoria de 64kg
					
					1o lugar: Wang Myong Guk (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Azat Shuitbayev (Kazajstan)
					
					3o lugar: Abdul Hutsaev (Rusia), Mykola Yakovenko (Ucrania)
						
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 45kg
					
					1o lugar: Ri Un Jong (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Miller Kirsty (Inglaterra)
					
					3o lugar: Mariia Klochkova (Rusia), Kremzhanova (Kazajstan)
					
					
					
					Parrins individual (f) de la categoria de 51kg
					
					1o lugar: Ri Hyang Mi (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Luliia Sukhareva (Rusia)
					
					3o lugar: Anna Tishchenko (Rusia), Jenine Hutchison (Inglaterra)
					
					
					
					Partido de defensa personal (m)
					
					1o lugar: RPDC
					
					2o lugar: Mongolia
					
					3o lugar: la India
					
					
					
					Partido de defensa personal (f)
					
					1o lugar: RPDC
					
					2o lugar: Rusia
					
					3o lugar: Checo
					
					
					
					Power individual (m)
					
					1o lugar: Yordan Staev (Bulgaria)
					
					2o lugar: Andrii Klymenko (Ucrania)
					
					3o lugar: Battulga Jargal (Mongolia)
					
					
					
					Power individual (f)
					
					1o lugar: Kim Un Hwa (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Karen Frondigoun (Escocia)
					
					3o lugar: Ros Sreynich (Camboya)
					
					
					
					Power colectivo (m)
					
					1o lugar: Mongolia
					
					2o lugar: Bulgaria
					
					3o lugar: RPDC
					
					
					
					Power colectivo (f)
					
					1o lugar: Checo
					
					2o lugar: RPDC
					
					3o lugar: Inglaterra
					
					
					
					Tecnica especial individual (m)
					
					1o lugar: Khvan Ilya (Kazajstan)
					
					2o lugar: Nikola Nikolov (Bulgaria)
					
					3o lugar: Aleksandr Poliakov (Rusia)
					
					
					
					Tecnica especial individual (f)
					
					1o lugar: Kim Il Hwa (RPDC)
					
					2o lugar: Kokasova Veronika (Checo)
					
					3o lugar: Elizaveta Pronchatova (Rusia)
					
					
					
					Tecnica especial colectiva (m)
					
					1o lugar: Rusia
					
					2o lugar: Kazajstan
					
					3o lugar: Camboya
					
					
					
					Tecnica especial  colectiva (f)
					
					1o lugar: Checo
					
					2o lugar: Rusia
					
					3o lugar: RPDC.

articles.title: Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete para los participantes del XX campeonato
articles.content:
Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete para los participantes del XX campeonato
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 21 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo un banquete en honor de los participantes en el XX Campeonato Mundial de Taekwon-do.
					A la ocasion fueron invitados Ri Yong Son, presidente de la Federacion Internacional de Taekwon-do (ITF en ingles) y del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales (CIJAM), el presidente honorario Jang Ung, los miembros ejecutivos de ITF, los presidentes de los comites permanentes y de las federaciones continentales, los representantes de las asociaciones nacionales, los equipos y delegaciones de varios paises y regiones.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Jon Kwang Ho, Kim Kyong Ho, presidente del Comite de Taekwon-do de Corea y del comite organizador del campeonato, y los funcionarios interesados.
					
					El vicepremier subrayo en su discurso que el gobierno de la RPDC ira cooperando de modo activo para la divulgacion y desarrollo de Taekwon-do en todo el mundo prestando profunda atencion a este arte marcial en acato a los legados del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que bajo la bandera de justicia y paz, ITF consolidara la armonia y unidad de los taekwondocas desarrollando las tecnicas de Taekwon-do conforme a su mision de organizacion de este arte marcial.
					
					El vicepresidente de ITF, Leong Wai Meng, apunto en su intervencion que los taekwondocas ortodoxos no olvidaran nunca las grandes benevolencias de Su Excelencia Kim Il Sung y Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il dispensadas para Choe Hong hui e ITF.

articles.title: Seleccion coreana avanza a final de Campeonato (f) Sub-16 de CAF 2017
articles.content:
Seleccion coreana avanza a final de Campeonato (f) Sub-16 de CAF 2017
Pyongyang, 21 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La seleccion femenina de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea participara en la final del Campeonato (f) Sub-16 de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol 2017, iniciado desde el dia 10 en Tailandia.
					En la cita deportiva, las selecciones de los 8 paises y regiones realizaron las eliminatorias divididos en 2 grupos y dos equipos sobresalientes de cada grupo compitieron de manera de knock-out.
					
					La seleccion coreana, perteneciente al grupo B, jugo con sus rivales de Bangladesh, Australia y Japon. En la semifinal competio con el equipo chino del grupo A.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 20 la semifinal entre Corea y China.
					
					Las futbolistas coreanas vencieron por 1:0 a las sus rivales chinos, asi que ganaron el boleto para la Copa Mundial (f) sub-17 de la FIFA de 2018.
					
					La final entre la RPDC y el Sur de Corea se realizara el dia 23.
